This LPT screams immaturity and a passive aggressive nature.

Ugh I can imagine the letter of recommendation I write in this instance.

 "Employee X wants a raise but instead of working hard to earn it they pack up and quit when challenged to improve."

Why would an employer do this?
Passive aggressive will not get you anywhere. Instead, ask for feedback on how to meet the performance criteria for a raise.
teabag your boss's desk while you're at it. let them know how you *really* feel. 😂
